page.title: 16Geographical Background
page.content: The fault line which divides the southern uplands from the central lowlands runs across the area from N.E. to S.W. The south east corner is underlaid with hard ordovician rocks that can be seen in the Thorter Glen. Most of the rest of the base rock is old red sandstone but volcanic rock outcrop on the law knowles north of the village.The rocks are overlaid with glacial gravels which although stoney provide good farming land. The volcanic outcrops has poor pasture used by ponies. The drainage pattern is a result of post glacial erosion, deep channels have been cut through the gravels, one of these is occupied by the Papana river. In places it has cut into the soft sandstone as can be seen on the steep south bank. The flat bottom of the Papana valley is covered with gravels and makes a flood plain.
